meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to spread or disperse through a medium.
meanings.sent1: The diffusivities of perfume in the air can create a pleasant smell throughout the room.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the diffusivities of various gases to understand how they move in different environments.
meanings.sent3: The diffusivities of rumors in a small town can lead to exaggerated stories spreading quickly.
meanings.sent4: The diffusivities of light through a prism demonstrate the separation of colors in a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The diffusivities of ink in water can be observed under a microscope, showing the intricate patterns formed.

meanings.definition: The rate at which a substance diffuses.
meanings.sent1: The diffusivities of sugar in hot water increase with higher temperatures.
meanings.sent2: Chemists measure the diffusivities of solutes in solvents to determine their behavior in solutions.
meanings.sent3: The diffusivities of ants in search of food can be surprisingly fast when they work together.
meanings.sent4: In a crowded room, the diffusivities of sound waves make it challenging to hear individual conversations.
meanings.sent5: The diffusivities of heat in a metal rod illustrate how quickly temperature changes can propagate.
